triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: The paper advances swarm robotics by integrating biological organisms with control theory to create intelligent autonomous systems.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory is used to develop the swarm navigation algorithm for coordinating multi-cyborg systems.

triples.name: Cyborg
triples.relevance: The paper introduces cyborg insects as hybrid bio-robotic systems that combine living insects with miniature electronic controllers.

triples.name: Robot
triples.relevance: Robots are used as a comparison point to highlight the advantages of cyborg insects in adaptation and energy efficiency.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: The paper develops autonomous systems through cyborg insects that operate independently with programmable control.

triples.name: Robot navigation
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a swarm navigation algorithm to solve the navigation task for multiple cyborg insects in unknown obstructed terrain.
